text: Does anyone know stories about memoization? I want to give a presentation about a memoization system and it will be nice to open with a real world story.

elements.text: Does anyone know stories about memoization? I want to give a presentation about a memoization system and it will be nice to open with a real world story.

text:
Parsing date times.
For loading CSVs.
Parsing a datetime is relatively fast, but not as fast as hashing a datetime length string.
And since in a spatial-temporal/panel dataset (one indexed by time and location) each time stamp is repreated for each location (so thousands of times for us) this gives big gains.

Especially because parsing real world data is messy. Parsing a date time actually means calling `tryparse` up to 5 or 6 times to try and find out what format it actually is in.

Adding a cache around the parse have a 7x speedup on total data loading time. Over 1 hour down to under 10 minutes.

Also cut down on memory use since it wasn't allocating fresh memory for each.

text: Is that code available somewhere? Or an example? This sounds really interesting to learn more about
